intro: Rostkovia sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the globe cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its spherical, fleshy fruits that resemble small, rounded globes. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Rostkovia sphaerocarpa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
